Sioux_City.Sioux City Municipal Auditorium: The Sioux City Municipal Auditorium, now known as the Long Lines Family Recreation Center, is a 3,500-seat multi-purpose arena in Sioux City, Iowa, United States. The fifth in a line of major indoor venues built in Sioux City, it was designed by Knute E. Westerlind in 1938 and finally completed after many delays in 1950. In 2003, the building was replaced by the Tyson Events Center, built around the northeast corner of the Municipal Auditorium.
